summary: Email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and federal prosecutors regarding requests for additional photos and surveillance video from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following his death. The correspondence reveals ongoing efforts by the defense to obtain evidence and mentions a prior miscommunication about video preservation.

events.title: Defense Request for Epstein Cell Evidence
events.description: Defense attorney Bruce Barket emails federal prosecutors requesting additional photos and surveillance video from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at MCC from the time of the initial response and after Epstein was removed.

events.title: Prosecutors Inform of Video Preservation
events.description: Prosecutors inform the defense that surveillance video from Epstein's cell was preserved upon request and will be made available for review, though delayed until the New Year.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - implied location of Epstein's cell
Garden City, NY 11530 - address of Bruce Barket's law firm
New York, New York 10007 - address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense team for Nicholas Tartaglione was actively seeking additional photographic and video evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at MCC following Epstein's death.
There was a prior miscommunication between the defense and prosecutors regarding the preservation of surveillance video from Epstein's cell.
Prosecutors confirmed on December 19, 2019, that the requested video had been preserved and would be made available for review, though with a delay.
The email chain indicates ongoing legal efforts to obtain and review evidence related to the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death in custody.
